summary: The Debt, Earnings, and Cost Information Disclosure for Education Act (DECIDE Act) aims to improve transparency and accountability for federal student loan borrowers. It mandates the Secretary of Education to annually expand and update the College Scorecard with program-level data, including median earnings, debt levels (Federal Direct Stafford Loans, Graduate PLUS Loans, Parent PLUS Loans), default rates, and repayment rates. It also requires the inclusion of institution-level data such as cohort default rates and repayment rates, and specific data regarding PLUS loans. The bill defines cohort default rate and repayment rate.
